title: Step 1 - Create a New Stocktake (Blank)
text: Step 1: Select Create New to start the process. Step 2: Type in a meaningful description for the stocktake. Step 3: From the stocktake type drop-down, select Partial. Step 4: Select the desired shop from the shop drop-down. Step 5: In the "Add partial Stocktake Selection" section, choose Blank from the drop-down. Step 6: Since it's a Blank stocktake, there are no filter selections required. Step 7: Click SAVE to save the Partial Blank stocktake. Step 8: Wait a few moments and you will be taken to the newly created Stocktake form. Step 9: From the drop-down menu, select the created stocktake to proceed.
description:
Step 1: Select Create New to start the process.



Step 2: Type in a meaningful description for the stocktake.



Step 3: From the stocktake type drop-down, select Partial.

Step 4: Select the desired shop from the shop drop-down.

Step 5: In the "Add partial Stocktake Selection" section, choose Blank from the drop-down.


Step 6: Since it's a Blank stocktake, there are no filter selections required.

Step 7: Click SAVE to save the Partial Blank stocktake.



Step 8: Wait a few moments and you will be taken to the newly created Stocktake form.

Step 9: From the drop-down menu, select the created stocktake to proceed.

title: Step 2 - Count Add Items to Stocktake
text: Certainly! Here are the steps to add items to the stocktake: Step 1. Find the stocktake you want to work with from the drop-down menu. Step 2. Once you have selected the stocktake, click on the "Count" button to begin the counting process. Step 3. Ensure that you have selected the correct partial blank stocktake by checking the message displayed on the screen. This will open a counting page where you can add items manually or import counts from a file. If you choose to import from a file, refer to the separate section on File Import for instructions. Step 4. Enter the physical section you are currently counting. You have the option to add counts in individual sections that reflect how you break down the count within the shop. For example, stockroom, gondolas/stands, display windows, cupboards, etc. If you are importing, the sections may be based on the import file. You can select and modify these individual count lists later before completing the stocktake. - If you leave this field blank, all counts will be shown under the header of "Default" in the Count drop-down list. Step 5. Enter the barcode of the item you want to add. You can either scan the barcode or manually enter it into the barcode box. Once selected, a default quantity of 1 will be added. - Alternatively, you can manually search for an item using the "Find Item Manually" option. You can search by text, vendor, or item groups. Once selected, a default quantity of 1 will be added. Step 6. The "Total Number of Unique Barcodes" field displays the number of entries in the stocktake. Step 7. The "Total Counted Quantities" field shows the total number of counted quantities. Step 8. If you want to deduct the quantity when an item is added via the barcode entry, set the "Negate Quantity" option to "Yes". Step 9. For a Partial Blank stocktake, set the "Add Items Not Currently in Stocktake" option to "Yes" if you want to add items that are not already included in the stocktake. If set to "No," no items can be added. Step 10. To manually search for an item, follow these steps: - Enter the search text, which can be a whole word or use an asterisk (*) before or after the word to search for all possibilities. For example, "can*" for candles or "*proof" for waterproof. - Use the drop-down menu to select one or more vendors from the list. - Use the drop-down menu to select one or more item groups from the list. - Click the "Search" button to start the search process. The results will be displayed in the list below. These steps will guide you through the process of adding items to the stocktake and manually searching for items within the stocktake.
description:
Certainly! Here are the steps to add items to the stocktake:


Step 1. Find the stocktake you want to work with from the drop-down menu.


Step 2. Once you have selected the stocktake, click on the "Count" button to begin the counting process.

Step 3. Ensure that you have selected the correct partial blank stocktake by checking the message displayed on the screen.




This will open a counting page where you can add items manually or import counts from a file. If you choose to import from a file, refer to the separate section on File Import for instructions.


Step 4. Enter the physical section you are currently counting. You have the option to add counts in individual sections that reflect how you break down the count within the shop. For example, stockroom, gondolas/stands, display windows, cupboards, etc. If you are importing, the sections may be based on the import file. You can select and modify these individual count lists later before completing the stocktake.

   - If you leave this field blank, all counts will be shown under the header of "Default" in the Count drop-down list.


Step 5. Enter the barcode of the item you want to add. You can either scan the barcode or manually enter it into the barcode box. Once selected, a default quantity of 1 will be added.

   - Alternatively, you can manually search for an item using the "Find Item Manually" option. You can search by text, vendor, or item groups. Once selected, a default quantity of 1 will be added.


Step 6. The "Total Number of Unique Barcodes" field displays the number of entries in the stocktake.


Step 7. The "Total Counted Quantities" field shows the total number of counted quantities.


Step 8. If you want to deduct the quantity when an item is added via the barcode entry, set the "Negate Quantity" option to "Yes".


Step 9. For a Partial Blank stocktake, set the "Add Items Not Currently in Stocktake" option to "Yes" if you want to add items that are not already included in the stocktake. If set to "No," no items can be added.




Step 10. To manually search for an item, follow these steps:

   - Enter the search text, which can be a whole word or use an asterisk (*) before or after the word to search for all possibilities. For example, "can*" for candles or "*proof" for waterproof.

   - Use the drop-down menu to select one or more vendors from the list.

   - Use the drop-down menu to select one or more item groups from the list.

   - Click the "Search" button to start the search process. The results will be displayed in the list below.


These steps will guide you through the process of adding items to the stocktake and manually searching for items within the stocktake.

title: Step 3 - Manual Count
text: Here are the steps for manual counting: Step 1. If you are counting by sections, enter a description in the physical section box to specify the section you are counting. Step 2. Scan or manually enter a barcode to count items, or use the "Find Item Manually" option to search for items and adjust their count quantities. Each time you scan a barcode, the quantity is increased by 1, and the most recently scanned item is displayed in the "Last Scanned item" box. You can manually adjust the quantity in the "Last Scanned item" box instead of the Manual Count list before moving to the next item. Alternatively, if you are adding items directly from the item list, you can use the "+" and "-" buttons or directly choose the quantity field to adjust the count quantities. the quantity is limited to a maximum value of 10 digits (e.g., 9999999999) and up to a maximum of 2 decimals (e.g., 99999999.99). The minimum value is 0. Step 3. You can use the "Items by page [5 10 20 50]" and the "Page number [7 of 11 (54 items)]" to scroll through and find more items in the list. Step 4. Once you have added all the counts, choose the "Back" button to close the count page. All counts are automatically saved. Step 5. If you entered a description into the Physical section box, it will appear in the Count list. Step 6. Use the drop-down menu to see all counts and select a specific count. Step 7. To add more individual counts with different physical descriptions, choose "Count" again from the top right-hand side (Step 3) and add a different physical description. Note: To amend a specific location (e.g., Location 55G), choose "Count" again from the top right-hand side (Step 3) and type in the same description again. It must be the same to update the existing count location; otherwise, it will create a new count location. These steps will guide you through the process of manual counting, adjusting quantities, and navigating the count page.
description:
Here are the steps for manual counting:


Step 1. If you are counting by sections, enter a description in the physical section box to specify the section you are counting.


Step 2. Scan or manually enter a barcode to count items, or use the "Find Item Manually" option to search for items and adjust their count quantities.

  • Each time you scan a barcode, the quantity is increased by 1, and the most recently scanned item is displayed in the "Last Scanned item" box.
  • You can manually adjust the quantity in the "Last Scanned item" box instead of the Manual Count list before moving to the next item.
  • Alternatively, if you are adding items directly from the item list, you can use the "+" and "-" buttons or directly choose the quantity field to adjust the count quantities.
  • the quantity is limited to a maximum value of 10 digits (e.g., 9999999999) and up to a maximum of 2 decimals (e.g., 99999999.99). The minimum value is 0.




Step 3. You can use the "Items by page [5 10 20 50]" and the "Page number [7 of 11 (54 items)]" to scroll through and find more items in the list.




Step 4. Once you have added all the counts, choose the "Back" button to close the count page. All counts are automatically saved.


Step 5. If you entered a description into the Physical section box, it will appear in the Count list.


 


Step 6. Use the drop-down menu to see all counts and select a specific count.




Step 7. To add more individual counts with different physical descriptions, choose "Count" again from the top right-hand side (Step 3) and add a different physical description.


Note: To amend a specific location (e.g., Location 55G), choose "Count" again from the top right-hand side (Step 3) and type in the same description again. It must be the same to update the existing count location; otherwise, it will create a new count location.


These steps will guide you through the process of manual counting, adjusting quantities, and navigating the count page.

title: Step 5 - Commit
text: Step 1: If all the discrepancies in the report are correct, choose Commit to accept the discrepancy report and update the stock figures. Step 2: Confirm the commitment by selecting Yes to proceed or No to cancel the Commit request. Step 3: The stocktake list will show "Committing" while making the final adjustments and then display "Closed" when completed. Step 4: You can view the closed stocktake again by clicking on it in the stocktake list.
description:
Step 1: If all the discrepancies in the report are correct, choose Commit to accept the discrepancy report and update the stock figures.



Step 2: Confirm the commitment by selecting Yes to proceed or No to cancel the Commit request.



Step 3: The stocktake list will show "Committing" while making the final adjustments and then display "Closed" when completed.






Step 4: You can view the closed stocktake again by clicking on it in the stocktake list.
